thread.title: Canuxploitation Classic Cathy’s Curse Comes to Blu-ray
thread.title_full: Canuxploitation Classic Cathy’s Curse Comes to Blu-ray

author: Chris Alexander
title: Canuxploitation Classic Cathy’s Curse Comes to Blu-ray
text:
February 15, 2017 SHARE Notorious Canadian Exorcist/Omen ripoff Cathy’s Curse comes to Blu-ray fully restored for the first time 
On April 11th, Severin Films will unleash the fully restored version of notorious Canadian “bad seed” shocker Cathy’s Curse . Rejoice! This grimy gem has been a staple of late night TV and public domain dump bins for decades but you’ve never seen it like this… 
Fans can now experience one of the strangest downmarket horror flicks (also known in French Canada as Cauchemares ) like never before, transferred in 2k from recently-found film elements and featuring revealing new extras with long-lost star Randi Allen and producer/director/co-writer Eddy Matalon. 
RELATED: Top 15 Canuxploitation films 
Forget what you’ve seen in blurry bootlegs and crappy budget packs. This first- ever restoration of the depraved Canadian shocker is being hailed as the genre rediscovery of the year: In 1947, a young girl is roasted alive in a car accident. Thirty years later, her grown brother returns to their childhood home with his mentally unstable wife and sweet daughter Cathy. But when the dead aunt’s vengeful spirit possesses the child, it will unleash an unnerving nightmare of creepy mediums, demonic dolls, and plenty of sick ‘70s foul-mouthed moppet mayhem. 
SPECIAL FEATURES:
